description_html:
✨ Experience elevated downtown living from the 22nd floor with breathtaking views of the Calgary Tower and city skyline! Perfectly situated near the Stampede Grounds, Saddledome, and BMO Centre, this stylish condo offers resort-style amenities — including a seasonal pool, gym, and BBQ terrace. Enjoy a FREE Banff Park Pass, complimentary wine, and luxurious comfort — ideal for couples, families, and business travelers seeking a vibrant Calgary getaway! ✨

The space
🏡 The Space
Welcome to your elevated city retreat! This stylish 22nd-floor condo pairs spectacular skyline + mountain views with amazing amenities. Perfect for exploring the heart of Calgary or relaxing poolside.

💖 Why You’ll Love It
✅ Breathtaking 22nd-Floor Views – Wake up to panoramic skyline and Calgary Tower views that capture the city’s energy and beauty.
✅ Downtown Location – Steps from the Stampede Grounds, Saddledome, and BMO Centre — perfect for concerts, hockey games, and events.
✅ Resort-Style Amenities – Enjoy the outdoor pool (seasonal), firepit lounge, BBQ terrace, fitness centre, and library.
✅ FREE Banff Park Pass – Explore world-famous Banff National Park with complimentary access for up to 7 guests.
✅ Luxury Comforts – Modern furnishings, premium bedding, central A/C, and floor-to-ceiling windows for a high-end stay.
✅ Entertainment Ready – 55” Smart TV with Netflix, high-speed WiFi, and cozy spaces for relaxing nights in.
✅ Thoughtful Touches – Complimentary wine, popcorn, tea, and coffee for a warm welcome.
✅ Private Balcony – Enjoy your morning coffee or evening glass of wine with sweeping city views.
✅ Convenient Parking & Check-In – FREE underground parking stall, secure entry, and self check-in before 11 PM.
✅ Ideal for All Travelers – Perfect for couples, families, business travelers, and long-term guests seeking elevated comfort.

🏊‍♂️ Resort-Style Building Amenities
▪ Outdoor pool (seasonal) with sun loungers & skyline views
▪ Firepit lounge + BBQ terrace for summer gatherings
▪ 24/7 fitness center with modern equipment
▪ Cozy library & community lounge — ideal for remote work or relaxing with a book

🏙️ Luxury Indoor Space
▪ 2 Queen bedrooms with plush bedding and city views
▪ Comfortable sofa bed for 2 extra guests
▪ Fully equipped modern kitchen – cookware, dishes, and Keurig coffee machine
▪ Dining table for 4 overlooking floor-to-ceiling windows
▪ 55” Smart TV with Netflix & high-speed WiFi
▪ In-suite washer & dryer for long stays
▪ Elegant design with modern décor and natural light

🌇 Private Outdoor Space
▪ Private balcony with panoramic skyline + Calgary Tower views
▪ Perfect for morning coffee, sunset wine, or city lights photography

Guest access
🔑 Guest Access
▪ Self check-in available anytime before 11 PM
▪ Entire condo is 100% private — no shared spaces
▪ Includes 1 secure underground parking stall
▪ 24/7 building access after check-in (before 11 pm)

Other things to note
🌄 Other Things to Note
▪ FREE Banff Pass (must request before arrival; valid during stay)
▪ Outdoor pool open seasonally (Subject to availability, weather-dependent; typically summer months)
▪ Optional extras:
 ▪ Travel Crib / High Chair – $25 each
 ▪ Cot – $50 (advance request required)

▪ Enso Connect - An Official Airbnb Partner! ▪
As an official Airbnb partner, Enso Connect is the only authorized third-party platform, offering trusted digital guest experience solutions exclusively for vacation rentals. We use Enso Connect for verification including ID, contact information, secure collection of security deposits OR waiver options, seamless check-in instructions and for helpful Guides to amazing local attractions - all in complete adherence to Airbnb's policies. Before making a reservation, kindly review the House Rules by visiting the House Rules section. By booking this property, you are confirming your agreement to comply with all house rules and policies.

location_details_html:
📍 The Neighborhood – Heart of Downtown Calgary
▪ Stay in Calgary’s most desirable urban hub — steps from the Stampede Grounds, Saddledome, and BMO Centre.
▪ Walk to Stephen Avenue, CORE Shopping Centre, and Prince’s Island Park for festivals, restaurants, and nightlife.
▪ Surrounded by the best dining, entertainment, and culture Calgary has to offer.

Nearby Highlights:
▪ Cowboys Casino – 6 min
▪ Calgary Tower – 7 min
▪ Scotiabank Saddledome – 7 min
▪ Peace Bridge – 6 min
▪ Calgary Zoo / TELUS Spark – 12–13 min
▪ Calgary Airport (YYC) – 19 min

Dining & Nightlife:
▪ The Guild | Modern Steak | Social Beer Haus
▪ Whiskey Rose | Jamesons Pub | Betty Lou’s Library
▪ Trendy cafés and brunch spots all within walking distance

description_html:
'Panache Ouest City Ranch' is located in the heart of Southwest Calgary's upscale Mission area. Seconds from the city's best districts ( 17th Avenue / 4th & 1st St ), we boast a 24-minute walk to the Saddledome & Stampede arenas.
Adjacent to Elbow River and its shoreside green-spaces, this eclectic, modern standalone has everything you'd want in a luxury rental. Full laundry, infrared sauna, a home-gym, rainfall shower, clawfoot tub, & dedicated workspaces make this Calgary oasis a stand-out.

The space
This heritage home comfortably hosts 5 guests, with two king size beds, and a trundle-bed sectional in the loft suite that houses its own additional bedding.

** FREE Private Parking available (in driveway) **

** We welcome longer term monthly booking inquiries- please put in a request to discuss in more details! **

Open-Concept Living: At the heart of this home is a multi-functional living, dining and entertainment space that easily seats six; featuring ample natural light, dedicated workspace, a gas fireplace, sprawling modular sectional and 4K 50" smart tv.

Our full-service kitchen is prepped for all your culinary and hosting needs. We proudly feature a brand-new fridge, freezer, stove, and air-fryer; a full-size dishwasher; and retro-style 10-cup drip coffee machine, electric kettle and radio-toaster! PLEASE NOTE: we do not have a microwave.

The main floor bedroom suite connects to a spacious walk-in closet, as well as a shared passthrough with secondary barn-door access. Guests can store luggage, get dressed, or come and go, with total ease and absolute privacy.

Main Floor Bedroom Suite: Rest & relaxation are guaranteed on our memory-foam, cloud-topped, king-size mattress and high-thread-count sheets. A 6-speed ceiling fan overhead, and nightstand lighting, plus four king pillows provide customizable comfort.

The Home-Spa: A central bathroom hosts this home's original 1912 cast-iron clawfoot tub, as well a modern walk-in shower. A reclaimed antique crystal chandelier is sure to set the mood for an evening of unwinding in a bubble bath or rainfall shower.

The Loft Suite: Features our second memory-foam, cloud-topped, king-size mattress, and four king pillows. A trundle-bed sectional acts as a day bed or sleep-space, while a nearby retro mini-fridge and antique desk provide a second dedicated workspace.

Our semi-finished basement sets the Panache Ouest City Ranch apart from the rest. Infrared sauna, home-gym, mud-room landing, and full laundry suite mean total comfort for a short or long term stay. * Please note: unfinished elements are not pictured *

A Private Picnic Courtyard is adjacent to the residence. Our weatherproof picnic table comfortably seats six, and solar-powered patio lights are self-timed to illuminate your evening gatherings. * Please note: Garage is not accessible to guests *

Guest access
Guests can access the entire property * with the exception of the front vestibule & freestanding garage. *

Other things to note
* Please note: only loft and kitchen windows are operational *

The pictures were deceiving and we felt like the apartment was wayyyy smaller than it seemed online. Even their couch is small and doesn‚Äôt even have a fold out bed - just an ottoman that pops up and we had to sleep two people on the tiny space.
Check-in is less than ideal - car full of people has to wait on the streets or drive around while one person gets let in and has to go to high floor to retrieve key fob and then come down to find car to park on 5th floor underground parking.
Plus, we were only left 4 towels for the 7 of us (owners did try to rectify this one thing for us), there‚Äôs only two chairs on patio with one cushion (picture shows a loveseat as well), the bedding for the trundle was not left for us so our son just had to use a random blanket, and the couch has no sheets for it, just a comforter for on top.
One tiny bathroom to share was hard, too.

I will never stay here again. I booked this property to celebrate my birthday, but instead spent the weekend struggling with allergies due to the place being dusty, unkempt, and overall unclean. Upon arrival, the floors were dirty, there was leftover laundry from previous guests, and hair was scattered on the floors. The towels were also stained, and the carpets were far from clean.
The hosts did manage to have the place cleaned the next day, which did make a noticeable difference, but the dust and uncleanliness still lingered. I highly suggest a thorough cleaning of the vents and carpets. As a Superhost, I expect a higher level of cleanliness, but unfortunately, this was not the case. While the hosts made an effort to address the situation, I should never have arrived to an Airbnb that was still in poor condition after the previous guest.

Featuring an equipped kitchen, bright living space, comfy bedrooms, and a dedicated workspace, it‚Äôs ideal for families, couples, or remote workers. Experience the best of Calgary with convenience and comfort‚Äîyour perfect retreat awaits!The space*Welcome to Your Home Away from Home in Calgary!****Location:**  Nestled in the heart of Calgary at 1029 14 Ave SW, our cozy apartment condo offers the perfect blend of convenience and comfort. Whether you're here for business, pleasure, or a bit of both, you'll find everything you need just steps away.**Property Highlights:**  - Prime Location: Situated in a vibrant neighborhood, you're just a short walk from popular attractions, restaurants, and shopping centers. Enjoy easy access to the best Calgary has to offer.- Comfortable Living: Our condo is thoughtfully furnished to ensure a relaxing stay. The bedroom features a comfortable bed and a fan to keep you cool.- Modern Amenities: Stay connected with Wi-Fi, and take advantage of our well-equipped kitchen for all your culinary needs.- Convenient Laundry: In-unit laundry is available for $10per load, with soap/softener included for your convenience.- Thoughtful Extras: For long stays, we provide extra bed sheets, allowing you to refresh your space as needed.**Local Amenities:**  - Grocery Stores:You'll find three major grocery stores‚ÄîSave on Foods, Safeway, and Co-op‚Äîjust two blocks away, making it easy to stock up on essentials.- Home-Cooked Meals:Our cohost Lina is a talented cook with permits to offer food. reviews: Perfect location, close to downtown but quiet and safe neighbourhood. The host responded super fast and was very helpful! The place was exactly the same as described on the website and clean! Highly recommend :)

Absolute amazing stay, the apartment was incredibly clean and well supplied with all materials for cooking utensils and cleaning products. The hosts were so kind and let us come in earlier to settle in nicely. We really enjoyed our time with Naomi and will definitely be coming back again, it was such a perfect location to enjoy calgery especially when going to the stampede!!

We were so lucky to find this place during the stampede! Clean, great quiet neighbourhood, and really spacious and comfortable. Naomi and team were super helpful and responsive, would definitely stay here again!

The entire experience was very good.  I was anxious to have an ideal place to stay overnight with my brother on a family visit to Calgary. Finding this apartment seemed perfect and the communication with all 3 contacts was prompt and informative. As a result we had a brilliant time in the city knowing we had a ce trsl and perfect apartment to return to. It was also very fairly priced when compared with other apartments on AirBnB. I'd have no hesitation using again and would recommend to anyone seeking accommodation in central calgary

A fantastic spot to stay in downtown Calgary. Clean, comfortable, nicely decorated and has everything you need. Great location that is easily walkable to restaurants, stores, parks and attractions. Nice neighbourhood, and good outdoor parking lot that was easy to use. Building was clean and quiet.  Host is responsive, friendly and provides easy-to-follow instructions. Much better value than nearby hotels  Would definitely stay here again. Thanks for a great stay.
Pretty nice place,Super clean , and a great Location ,  i aslo forget the keys in the apartment Very late night and Naomi answered me quickly to buzz me in.  I recommend üëå
We stayed in Naomi‚Äôs place for a month for work in Calgary. Great location, very safe and comfortable neighborhood. Will definitely stay again!

It was about 15minutes away by walk to go to the main downtown so it was convenient to access stores, restaurants.
The area was peaceful and quiet so I liked it.
Also I stayed here with my cats, there were most of amenities I needed so I didn't have to buy anything to stay at first except food.
And she checked if I need any help or have any problem.
Comfortable place to unwind or walkable to all the bars and restaurants.  Bed was nice and soft with black out curtains.

With a great location, Naomi's put us where we wanted to be for our stay in Calgary. The apartment was clean except for a couple oversights from the cleaners but it didn't affect our stay. The welcome goodies were a nice touch and appreciated. The bathroom was clean although make sure you like a high pressure shower before you get in! Our only downsides to our stay was the second bedroom bed and the flooring in the main part of the house; which Naomi was happy to address both things when we spoke privately and they are aiming to fix these things for future guests. The bed in the second room was a very hard squeaky mattress and unfortunately that was the downside in our stay as my husband and I couldn't stay together on it. The floors need some repairs as some tiles were broken and loose, but Naomi let me know they are working on getting them fixed which can be appreciated. Naomi's response time was quick and professional. We will be back to stay in the future with the changes made.
Would definitely stay here again on a return trip to Calgary. In great downtown area close to grocery stores, bakeries, restaurants and shopping.
Naomi was very friendly, and made sure we had everything we needed. She even left us with some goodies.

Stayed for two nights, mixed experience. Nice aesthetics but lacks some basic needs. Hosts are friendly and helpful. They were communicative and also arranged a fan upon request, though we had to sleep in about 25-30 degrees on the first night.
Parking instructions are quite confusing, we kept second doubting until the host confirmed (this could be easily resolved with attaching a picture and annotating it).
Internet pretty slow for WFH.
No kitchen paper towels provided.
Most pots and pans don‚Äôt have lids.
Only 2-3 dishwasher pods were given and kept in the open near the sink, they all got moist and stuck together.
Black and dark blue towels are provided, which is inappropriate, you can‚Äôt tell if it‚Äôs clean, white is a standard for a reason.
Bathtub has dark shower curtains and there‚Äôs no light in the shower area.
Toiletries (shampoo and all) are poured into glass bottles, you don‚Äôt know what you are using on your body.
Hope this helps the host and guests:)
The flat is really nice and quite big, within walking distance from the city centre and various food options.

Naomi's place is so cozy!! You can't get any better for location, anything you could possibly need is only a few blocks away. Great host! I will be definitely booking a return stay next time I'm in town.
Easy and convenient. Clean and lovely!
great place and location and great hoste

It's a great place to enjoy Stempid.
It was a lodging. Not only that, but the downtown was also within walking distance, so it was comfortable and nice. The kitchen and bathroom were clean and the interior was well done. The bed was comfortable, so I was able to sleep well. If I come back to Calgary, I think I'll definitely come back to this place.
Great location, nice large space, very clean. Would definitely stay here again!

Excellent accommodation to end our stay! Super cozy comfortable beds, super sofa for a relaxing evening, very quiet outside with beautiful views of the city, not far from the city center and the 17th, nice street for bars and restaurants hehe
We are delighted with our last days in Calgary!

Everything worked out well and I felt very comfortable right away. The apartment is very cozy, the area is very quiet and there are great restaurants nearby! By bus and also on foot, I could reach everything quickly. I had a good time and would come back!
We enjoyed our stay!
Great location, central yet quiet, nice apartment for our family with 2 children
Quiet area close to center The apartment is suitable for groups of friends or family.

description_html:
This stylish condo with private parking is just steps from trendy shops, restaurants, and vibrant nightlife, yet tucked away in a peaceful setting. Featuring an equipped kitchen, bright living space, comfy bedrooms, and a dedicated workspace, it’s ideal for families, couples, or remote workers.

As a bonus, we welcome well-behaved pets to join your stay. Experience the best of Calgary with convenience and comfort—your perfect retreat awaits!

The space
*Welcome to Your Home Away from Home in Calgary!**

**Location:**
Nestled in the heart of Calgary at 1029 14 Ave SW, our cozy apartment condo offers the perfect blend of convenience and comfort. Whether you're here for business, pleasure, or a bit of both, you'll find everything you need just steps away.

**Property Highlights:**
- Prime Location: Situated in a vibrant neighborhood, you're just a short walk from popular attractions, restaurants, and shopping centers. Enjoy easy access to the best Calgary has to offer.

- Comfortable Living: Our condo is thoughtfully furnished to ensure a relaxing stay. The bedroom features a comfortable bed and a fan to keep you cool.

- Modern Amenities: Stay connected with Wi-Fi, and take advantage of our well-equipped kitchen for all your culinary needs.

- Convenient Laundry: In-unit laundry is available for $10per load, with soap/softener included for your convenience.

- Thoughtful Extras: For long stays, we provide extra bed sheets, allowing you to refresh your space as needed.

**Local Amenities:**
- Grocery Stores:You'll find three major grocery stores—Save on Foods, Safeway, and Co-op—just two blocks away, making it easy to stock up on essentials.

- Home-Cooked Meals:Our cohost Lina is a talented cook with permits to offer food. She provides delicious home-cooked meals and shares her weekly menu every Friday. Please let us know if you’re interested.

- Public Transport: Convenient access to public transport ensures you can explore Calgary with ease.

We look forward to hosting you and ensuring you have a memorable stay in Calgary. If you have any questions or need assistance, please don't hesitate to reach out!

Other things to note
This amazing condo, is a no parties allowed, suitable for tourist, professionals, friends upholding the highest standards of care and enjoyment of the city. If this sounds like you, this is your home away from home!

Would definitely stay here again on a return trip to Calgary. In great downtown area close to grocery stores, bakeries, restaurants and shopping.
Naomi was very friendly, and made sure we had everything we needed. She even left us with some goodies.

Stayed for two nights, mixed experience. Nice aesthetics but lacks some basic needs. Hosts are friendly and helpful. They were communicative and also arranged a fan upon request, though we had to sleep in about 25-30 degrees on the first night.
Parking instructions are quite confusing, we kept second doubting until the host confirmed (this could be easily resolved with attaching a picture and annotating it).
Internet pretty slow for WFH.
No kitchen paper towels provided.
Most pots and pans don‚Äôt have lids.
Only 2-3 dishwasher pods were given and kept in the open near the sink, they all got moist and stuck together.
Black and dark blue towels are provided, which is inappropriate, you can‚Äôt tell if it‚Äôs clean, white is a standard for a reason.
Bathtub has dark shower curtains and there‚Äôs no light in the shower area.
Toiletries (shampoo and all) are poured into glass bottles, you don‚Äôt know what you are using on your body.
Hope this helps the host and guests:)
reviews_details.host_response:
Thank you for your feedback Anikesh.
the condo is in a concrete building that stays naturally cool and cools quickly with fans. As stated in the listing, there is no AC, which is common in Calgary.
We use black and navy towels for their quality and durability, and all linens are professionally laundered. Soaps and shampoos are provided in clearly labeled glass bottles as part of our eco-conscious approach. We only provide quality products.
Our cleaning care team follows the highest standards, and we pride ourselves on offering a spotless, well-equipped space.
Unfortunately, this guest left the unit dirty, left balcony doors open, and did not follow checkout instructions, creating safety and cleanliness concerns.
We remain committed to delivering a high-quality experience for respectful guests.

reviews_details.review: The flat is really nice and quite big, within walking distance from the city centre and various food options.

Naomi's place is so cozy!! You can't get any better for location, anything you could possibly need is only a few blocks away. Great host! I will be definitely booking a return stay next time I'm in town.
Easy and convenient. Clean and lovely!
great place and location and great hoste

name: Condo in Calgary ¬∑ ‚òÖ4.85 ¬∑ 2 bedrooms ¬∑ 2 beds ¬∑ 2 baths
description: Enjoy a modern stylish experience at this centrally located suite. Starting mid November, Christmas decor will be displayed to give a cozy homey feel during your visit. Beautiful views of the city. The location is key to an enjoyable stay and unbeatable, with restaurants, shops and entertainment on the same street. All of this  within walking distance, featuring a FREE SECURE PARKADE PARKING SPOT. Smooth virtual check in.  Bathrobe and slippers. Like a hotel, but a little more like home.The spaceThis apartment unit has two private bedrooms connected with a hallway, each room featuring a queen size bed. One bathroom is communal off the hallway, accessible to all guests.  One bathroom has private access through the Main Bedroom. Convenient, well lit work space, that can easily be tucked away. Kitchen is equipped for basic cooking needs. Nespresso pods, tea, hot chocolate are provided for your enjoyment during your stay. Air conditioning for the warmer months. Fireplace for the creating a comfortable relaxing stay during cooler months, with the option of extra heat output! Ideal for business trips, couples looking for a romantic retreat, families on vacation, groups of friends, and even solo travellers in search of extra space.Bathroom: one bath towel per guest, face towel, hand towel and bath mat. Toddler Friendly: pack'n'play, small bin of toddler/baby toys, a couple books, highchair with tray.Other things to noteServices below may require an additional charge and arrangements made, please discuss prior to booking. - late check in (past midnight)- additional towels- upgraded desk chair and stationary monitor - air mattress rental - additional baby gear - additional keysRegistration DetailsBL268824
reviews:
The location cannot be beat. you're surrounded by so many good restaurants that is within walking distance.
The apartment was super clean and we appreciated it. We were grateful that there was also a washer and dryer in the unit which helps immensely especially when you have little ones.
we'd definitely stay again should we ever visit Calgary a second time.

Terrible host: I texted already about the time I will reach (11 pm), and when I reached I called for access and their was no response  üòë.  In midnight I was left stranded with my baby and family and lot of stress. I have to go to hotel and due this all this hasel my next went bad due to lack of sleep. Airbnb staff helped me on call to tackle as best as possible.
Fantastic location‚Ä¶walkable to concert at the Saddledome, lots of great restaurants and amenities just steps away and easily walkable to shopping downtown or on 17 Avenue. Loved our time here!

Amanda‚Äôs condo is in our favourite Beltline building but this was our first time staying in her unit, it will be our future go to! Her place is so clean, beautiful view and she is so friendly! My daughter forgot her computer and she messaged us right away and helped us make arrangements to get it returned to us. We were there for three nights and never used our car, everything is so close. Great big bathrooms with lots of counter space, comfy beds & couch, free Netflix. The units in this building are practically soundproof too which is lovely.

City Centre Suite is right on the beltline a short walk from BMO and the Stampede grounds. Everything was well thought out and the Nespresso coffee was awesome. The view at night of the city is beautiful and the place is just like the photos. Highly recommend!

We had a stress free incredible stay. So many options for food and entertainment right outside the door. Very clean and had everthing we required. The host was attentive to any messages and easy to deal with. Highly reccomend you stay here!!

This apartment is pristine - immaculate design, open plan, beautiful balcony. Plenty of space & privacy. The building is secure & easy to find/access. Plenty of food in the area and easy access to public transport. Kids playground across the street with plenty of squirrels & a resident large rabbit. The apartment was a great base to explore the city & a nice place to rest after a long day. Quality coffee machine and washer/dryer facilities were a great addition
Great location in the city! Close by lots of things to do, plenty of restaurants and coffee shops. Even though we had our car, we walked most of the time. Spacious apartment with a good view outside.

Amanda‚Äôs condo was great! It was clean, free of clutter, perfect location and most importantly for us it was kid friendly. Made travelling with our son significantly easier. I lf we ever find ourselves in Calgary again, I would 100% stay here again.

The apartment was great, centrally located. We were two different parties in the apartment so we appreciated having two bathrooms. Definitely a perk of the place, along with the great view. The building wad quiet as well.
Amanda was very responsive and all questions were answered in a timely manner.

Calgary Stampede Stay
We stayed at Amanda‚Äôs apartment as two couples before we set off on a road trip and found the location great. It was very handy for the stampede but also for some great bars and restaurants. We did a street art and beer tour and despite it raining the entire time we had a great time. The directions to access the apartment were spot on and communication was first rate. We would definitely recommend staying here.

We loved Amanda‚Äôs BnB. Great location! So many neat little shops nearby - bakery, coffee, markets, etc. as well as quick access to 8th avenue pedestrian street.
Enjoyed the bright and airy open concept living room/kitchen. The patio was an added bonus!
Beds were comfortable, space was very quiet, and having 2 bathrooms were a bonus.
Highly recommend, and we will look it up again if we‚Äôre visiting Calgary.

Good location for what our needs were. Area is a bit ‚Äúsketchy ‚Äú depending on where you walked. Bed linens were adequate with terrible pillows. Bedroom with ensuite has no windows so felt like you were in a dungeon with 4 of us staying in the unit. No paper towels/napkins, no Kleenex, any extras were non existent. Washcloths had long black hair left in them from previous patrons.
Amanda‚Äôs place was perfect for our stay in Calgary for a wedding. Her place was spacious, clean, and the kitchen had everything we needed! The robes and slippers were also a nice added touch!

We had a great time in Calgary! The location is awesome and near to lots of nice bars/restaurants and in a very walkable neighborhood. The instructions for check-in were super clear and the apt is spacious

I stayed here with a friend for three nights for a conference. Place is beautiful and well appointed. The bedrooms are big for a condo and there‚Äôs two full bathrooms, which was nice. The only criticism I have is the building itself. There‚Äôs not a lot of soundproofing between units, so we could hear everything that was going on upstairs. People were having loud parties until 3 AM and we could hear if they dropped something on the floor. It was quite loud With almost no soundproofing and kept us up at night. Other than that, great place to stay.
Great place to stay, reasonable and good location. Would highly recommend this place to someone else
Very comfortable, beautiful unit. Area was a little sketchy to walk around at night but during the day is lively with many great restaurants and very walkable.
Loved the location.  Perfect for everything we planned to do over the weekend and we were able to walk.

beautiful stay, her recommendations for places and food in a book provided we‚Äôre all great. Definitely recommend Native Tongue & Beltliner for anyone looking to stay in the future. Balcony had amazing views favourite morning sunrise spot during stay. So close to lots to do downtown. A great stay 10/10
Great stay ‚Äî simple check-in, very clean, and perfect location.
The place is great, super comfortable, clean, and centrally located. Amanda was very friendly. I would definitely stay here again and recommend it 100%.
Amanda‚Äôs Airbnb is lovely, clean, cosy, in a great location and lets in so much natural light. Would recommend and would happily stay here again. Thank you!

The extra details were great. Robe, slippers and a blanket for couch sitting. Great location!
would stay there again

description_html:
Enjoy a modern stylish experience at this centrally located suite.

Starting mid November, Christmas decor will be displayed to give a cozy homey feel during your visit. Beautiful views of the city. The location is key to an enjoyable stay and unbeatable, with restaurants, shops and entertainment on the same street. All of this within walking distance, featuring a FREE SECURE PARKADE PARKING SPOT. Smooth virtual check in. Bathrobe and slippers. Like a hotel, but a little more like home.

The space
This apartment unit has two private bedrooms connected with a hallway, each room featuring a queen size bed. One bathroom is communal off the hallway, accessible to all guests. One bathroom has private access through the Main Bedroom. Convenient, well lit work space, that can easily be tucked away. Kitchen is equipped for basic cooking needs. Nespresso pods, tea, hot chocolate are provided for your enjoyment during your stay. Air conditioning for the warmer months. Fireplace for the creating a comfortable relaxing stay during cooler months, with the option of extra heat output!

Ideal for business trips, couples looking for a romantic retreat, families on vacation, groups of friends, and even solo travellers in search of extra space.

Bathroom: one bath towel per guest, face towel, hand towel and bath mat.

Toddler Friendly: pack'n'play, small bin of toddler/baby toys, a couple books, highchair with tray.

Other things to note
Services below may require an additional charge and arrangements made, please discuss prior to booking.

- late check in (past midnight)
- additional towels
- upgraded desk chair and stationary monitor
- air mattress rental
- additional baby gear
- additional keys

name: Condo in Calgary ¬∑ ‚òÖ4.68 ¬∑ 1 bedroom ¬∑ 2 beds ¬∑ 1 bath
description: This cozy and inviting condo features a spacious balcony with epic views of downtown. It comfortably accommodates  two guests but we can host up to three guests thanks to a pull-out couch. It boasts a prime location just off the vibrant 17th avenue, steps away from shopping, entertainment, nightlife, parks, transit, sports venues, and urgent care. **NOTE: The condo has recently had a fresh coat of paint and the art‚Äôs come down, but it still wraps you up in cozy vibes like a favorite sweater <3The spaceWhile small, the suite has a dedicated bedroom with a queen bed, and a pullout  couch in the living room. The entire unit would be yours for your stay, you do not share with other guests.Guest accessKeys and Access fob will be given upon check-inOther things to notePlenty of free street parking nearby. The Sheldon Chumir Urgent Care Centre is just a 5-minute walk away, as is Safeway for your grocery needs. You‚Äôll also find a pharmacy and liquor store right across the street, along with a great selection of cafes and restaurants just around the corner. Overall, it‚Äôs a fantastic location for an inner city Calgary experience. If you‚Äôre visiting during Stampede, you can‚Äôt beat the location; walking distance to the grounds!Registration DetailsBL260632
reviews: Great location, great space. the furniture could use some updating but minor in the grand scheme of things. everything is very walkable, parking isn't too difficult to manage. I would absolutely stay here again. All the best!

Overall great experience! The condo was clean and homey. Very convenient location with lots of restaurants and bars around. A grocery store being walkable distance is also a huge plus. Had to park my car on the street but finding a spot wasn't too bad.

Torie and Tyler were super flexible with our plans. They responded quite quickly to any questions we had. Their place is walkable to a lot of amenities and funky restaurants. Street was quiet. Would definitely stay here again!
We had a great stay! The place was clean, comfortable, and exactly as described. The host was responsive, which made everything smooth. Perfect for a short trip. Would definitely book again!
Great place üëåüèæ Torie and Tyler  communicated well. Despite not being able to enjoy the area its in an excellent area for dining, walking and enjoying the 17 Ave vibe! Thank you üòä

Super convenient location and the condo was the perfect meet between everything you could have needed and the perfect amount of space!! Torie and Tyler were ever so accommodating. I really enjoyed my stay, thank you
Tone of voice host used was not professional. Location is good. Parking is fine but has handicap sign. Wasn‚Äôt sure if it was correct to park there. Nails popping out on table. No A/C.
Great location and perfect size. I‚Äôll be staying there again whenever I‚Äôm back in the area. Very happy with everything.
Great place! Very clean, close to a lot of activities and restaurants but still in a quiet street.

Extremely clean and great view from the balcony!
I‚Äôll definitely book again the location was amazing and the apartment has everything I‚Äôll ever need
Great price for location. Check-in time of 5pm was a little abnormal but we made it work. Clean space and great balcony view.

easy check in instructions and very responsive! the apartment has a great view! plus the parking lot makes everything easier!
totally recommend!

Okay location- somewhat convenient. Apartment walls and doors were dirty, sofa bed was broken and uncomfortable. Parking was a nightmare, check-in and out was complicated. Host had their notifications silenced so we had to wait a bit for getting checked in, and they weren‚Äôt great with their response times. I don‚Äôt think I‚Äôd stay here again.
Great Apt close to 17th Ave and very walkable. Bed was comfortable and the place was spotless clean
Beautiful place, lovely interior. Torie and Tyler were amazing hosts and so responsive and flexible! recommend this place to everyone!

In the heart of the city.
Highly recommended!!
Comfortable and very clean place.
Beautiful views from the balcony.
Very nice location.
A wonderful spot to stay if you want to feel connected to the big Calgary city life. Comfy bed, warm shower and amazing restaurants nearby.
Tori and Tyler‚Äôs place was an absolute gem of a place. It was very clean and was just as pictured. They were super reliable and responsive and I would love to stay here again!

Our stay at Torie and Tyler‚Äôs place was fantastic! The space was clean, cozy, and exactly as described. The hosts were super responsive, went out of their way to accommodate our schedule, and made check-in a breeze. The location was perfect for exploring Calgary. I‚Äôd definitely book again!

Clean, affordable, and very easy check in, not to mention it being smack dab in a beautiful location. Absolutely loved the cute cozy interior even though i wasnt there for very long, the place had everything youd need and it comes with a great view. Holing to visit again if im in calgary.

Beautiful high-end kitchen with all the amenities. Super clean. Stayed here one night with my son, and the neighborhood was filled with great restaurants and walkable. The hosts were really helpful with recommendations and considerations, and very friendly and responsive.
Only thing I would say is that I would recommend leaving any large suitcases in the car as there is not much space to move around inside the unit with all the decorations. not much space to move around in the kitchen once the chairs are placed around the table. No noise at all and a phenomenal view.
Great place, excellent location. Only stayed 1 night but came away very relaxed. Had a nice bath in their soaker tub, and enjoyed the beautiful view of the city lights. Thanks again!

Nice place, fantastic location with lots of nice bars and cafes nearby. Only thing was there are no blinds over the balcony door, so you will get a ton of sunshine in the morning, which could be an issue if you're a light sleeper.

We had such a wonderful time at your Airbnb! It was cute, comfortable, had everything we needed, and was in a great location. Thank you SO much!
The reviews about the place being small are a bit overblown. It‚Äôs a studio apartment and has everything you‚Äôd need. It‚Äôs far better than a hotel.
The other reviews about the check-in time seem strange. We found the host accommodating and friendly. They were clear about their check-in and check-out times. As a night owl it was perfect to have such a late check-out time.

listing_title: Tiny & Charming, Heart of 17th
listing_name: Entire condo in Calgary, Canada

location_details.title: Neighborhood highlights
location_details.value: 17th Avenue is a very desirable area of Calgary with an abundance of shops, caf√©s and entertainment nearby. Our condo is a  10 minute walk to  the downtown core and Stephen's Ave, where there is an upscale mall (with Holt Renfrew) and plenty of dining. The C-train, Stampede grounds and MNP Sports Centre are also a 10-15 minute walk.  Additionally, there are a variety of parks and river pathways in the area. Eau Claire Market and Prince's Island Park are about a 35 minute walk north, which is a gorgeous area to wander around in the summer - with shops, dining and a splash park for children to enjoy. The Elbow river is around a 15 minute walk south and is great for its running pathways, parks, outdoor pool, BBQ pits and rafting during summer months.

location_details.title: Getting around
location_details.value: The C-train is a 10 minute walk away, and all stops in the downtown core are free. Uber, Taxi's, buses can also be found along 17th avenue.

description_by_sections.value: This cozy and inviting condo features a spacious balcony with epic views of downtown. It comfortably accommodates  two guests but we can host up to three guests thanks to a pull-out couch. It boasts a prime location just off the vibrant 17th avenue, steps away from shopping, entertainment, nightlife, parks, transit, sports venues, and urgent care. **NOTE: The condo has recently had a fresh coat of paint and the art‚Äôs come down, but it still wraps you up in cozy vibes like a favorite sweater <3

description_by_sections.value: While small, the suite has a dedicated bedroom with a queen bed, and a pullout  couch in the living room. The entire unit would be yours for your stay, you do not share with other guests.

description_by_sections.title: Other things to note
description_by_sections.value: Plenty of free street parking nearby. The Sheldon Chumir Urgent Care Centre is just a 5-minute walk away, as is Safeway for your grocery needs. You‚Äôll also find a pharmacy and liquor store right across the street, along with a great selection of cafes and restaurants just around the corner. Overall, it‚Äôs a fantastic location for an inner city Calgary experience. If you‚Äôre visiting during Stampede, you can‚Äôt beat the location; walking distance to the grounds!

description_html:
This cozy and inviting condo features a spacious balcony with epic views of downtown. It comfortably accommodates two guests but we can host up to three guests thanks to a pull-out couch. It boasts a prime location just off the vibrant 17th avenue, steps away from shopping, entertainment, nightlife, parks, transit, sports venues, and urgent care.

**NOTE: The condo has recently had a fresh coat of paint and the art’s come down, but it still wraps you up in cozy vibes like a favorite sweater <3

The space
While small, the suite has a dedicated bedroom with a queen bed, and a pullout couch in the living room. The entire unit would be yours for your stay, you do not share with other guests.

Guest access
Keys and Access fob will be given upon check-in

Other things to note
Plenty of free street parking nearby. The Sheldon Chumir Urgent Care Centre is just a 5-minute walk away, as is Safeway for your grocery needs. You’ll also find a pharmacy and liquor store right across the street, along with a great selection of cafes and restaurants just around the corner. Overall, it’s a fantastic location for an inner city Calgary experience. If you’re visiting during Stampede, you can’t beat the location; walking distance to the grounds!

Overall great experience! The condo was clean and homey. Very convenient location with lots of restaurants and bars around. A grocery store being walkable distance is also a huge plus. Had to park my car on the street but finding a spot wasn't too bad.

Torie and Tyler were super flexible with our plans. They responded quite quickly to any questions we had. Their place is walkable to a lot of amenities and funky restaurants. Street was quiet. Would definitely stay here again!
We had a great stay! The place was clean, comfortable, and exactly as described. The host was responsive, which made everything smooth. Perfect for a short trip. Would definitely book again!
Great place üëåüèæ Torie and Tyler  communicated well. Despite not being able to enjoy the area its in an excellent area for dining, walking and enjoying the 17 Ave vibe! Thank you üòä

reviews_details.host_response:
Hi Tae,
Our message clearly states to please contact us as soon as there‚Äôs an issue so we can address it promptly. However, we didn‚Äôt receive any communication from you, nor did you respond to my follow-up messages.
Given the lack of outreach on your end, it‚Äôs unclear how the ‚Äútone‚Äù could be perceived as unprofessional when there was little to no communication to begin with. A three-star rating seems excessive considering no effort was made to allow us the opportunity to rectify any concerns.
We‚Äôre always happy to resolve issues when they‚Äôre brought to our attention, and we appreciate honest feedback but it‚Äôs most helpful when it comes with dialogue.
Best regards

totally recommend!

A wonderful spot to stay if you want to feel connected to the big Calgary city life. Comfy bed, warm shower and amazing restaurants nearby.
Tori and Tyler‚Äôs place was an absolute gem of a place. It was very clean and was just as pictured. They were super reliable and responsive and I would love to stay here again!

Our stay at Torie and Tyler‚Äôs place was fantastic! The space was clean, cozy, and exactly as described. The hosts were super responsive, went out of their way to accommodate our schedule, and made check-in a breeze. The location was perfect for exploring Calgary. I‚Äôd definitely book again!

Clean, affordable, and very easy check in, not to mention it being smack dab in a beautiful location. Absolutely loved the cute cozy interior even though i wasnt there for very long, the place had everything youd need and it comes with a great view. Holing to visit again if im in calgary.

Beautiful high-end kitchen with all the amenities. Super clean. Stayed here one night with my son, and the neighborhood was filled with great restaurants and walkable. The hosts were really helpful with recommendations and considerations, and very friendly and responsive.
Only thing I would say is that I would recommend leaving any large suitcases in the car as there is not much space to move around inside the unit with all the decorations. not much space to move around in the kitchen once the chairs are placed around the table. Great place, excellent location. Only stayed 1 night but came away very relaxed. Had a nice bath in their soaker tub, and enjoyed the beautiful view of the city lights. Thanks again!

Nice place, fantastic location with lots of nice bars and cafes nearby. Only thing was there are no blinds over the balcony door, so you will get a ton of sunshine in the morning, which could be an issue if you're a light sleeper.

We had such a wonderful time at your Airbnb! It was cute, comfortable, had everything we needed, and was in a great location. Thank you SO much!
The reviews about the place being small are a bit overblown. It‚Äôs a studio apartment and has everything you‚Äôd need. It‚Äôs far better than a hotel.

I would not recommend staying here. The photos are outdated and don‚Äôt reflect the current condition‚Äîfloorboards are lifted and taped, surfaces grimy, floors sticky, and bedding smelled unwashed. Dishes and cutlery were greasy. The place felt very unclean. At check-in, the keys weren‚Äôt where instructed, and although parking was advertised, no key fob was provided, forcing us to pay for street parking. The worst issue was a power outage. No one came to resolve it, leaving the unit unstayable. We had to leave early and find another place. Nomadics Vacation Rentals offered no real help, repeatedly deflecting refund requests, never sending someone to fix it and even accused us of never checking out. Communication was frustrating. Very great place it was amazing thank you for being such a wonderful host

I rarely leave negative reviews, but this stay was disappointing. The listing photos are extremely misleading.. what we walked into was a completely different reality.
The unit was dirty: used mugs and cutlery in the sink, dried snot on the bathroom wall, baseboards caked with dust and grime, floor is lifting in the kitchen badly and pretty much every wall is covered in scuffs, dings, and visible damage. Cleanliness and upkeep were clearly not a priority here. There are no shades in one of the bedrooms. Reviews from months ago flagged this same issue, and it still hasn't been addressed, even with temporary curtains.. at least!
On top of that, there was a surprise request for an additional damage deposit fee before check in instructions would be provided.
Bottom line: luxury it is not. This place needs a deep clean, proper maintenance, and a host who‚Äôs willing to put some effort into the experience. I would not stay here again or recommend it to anyone.

We (4 colleagues on a work trip) enjoyed our stay at this airbnb & would recommend it. The airbnb had a pullout couch (fits 2 people tightly), a rollaway cot (fits 1 person), 1 king bed in 1 room, & another king bed in another room. The bedrooms are quite small - just a bed & some space to walk around it/put your stuff. There are 2 full bathroom, one attached to one bedroom & another attached to the living room. The bathrooms were functional & clean as was the kitchen (we struggled & failed to get the dishwasher to work, but that could have been user error?) & the washer/dryer. The view from the balcony is stunning - we spent a lot of time there. While the airbnb company sent instructions on how to get in, we did struggle entering the complex. There is also only one key fob which we had to juggle/share amongst 4 independent adults which was a bit difficult and cumbersome. The area was alright - walkable, close to downtown but there were a fair number of unhoused folks nearby.
Condo was nice but no shades in one of the rooms, Location was loud, and no sheets for pull out.

The place was great! Perfect location. Eddie was great with great communication!
Would definitely return

Nomadics Vacation rentals sent extremely detailed check in and check out instructions and the apartment matched the pictures shown in the listing. The apartment was extremely clean and clutter free. The amenities at this location looked nice although we did not have time to use any of them. We were unfortunately moved to this apartment after the initial apartment had an extremely last minute plumbing issue. The last minute nature of this issue and the communication regarding the change was rather frustrating. In addition, this new apartment had 1 less bedroom than my original booking. Forcing us to utilize the pull out bed, which would have been no big deal if sheets for this bed had been provided or available. In addition, all the extra pillows were provided with no pillow cases. we pulled pillows off the real beds for the couch to use. Location was easily walkable to the other downtown areas.
stains on the bath towel and sofa cushion, no curtain or blinds in one room which is extremely inconvenient and no privacy, should not happen with appartement like this

Unfortunately, our experience was quite disappointing. We arrived at the apartment on February 6th at 10:46 pm and immediately had trouble getting into the building. The doorman was unfriendly and unwilling to help, and the building control panel was very confusing, the buttons didn't work properly and there were no clear instructions. Inside the apartment, the curtain in the suite was damaged, which compromised our privacy, as we had to sleep completely exposed to the outside light. The next day, we asked for some flexibility with the check-out time, but the host was completely inflexible and wanted to charge an additional $125 just to stay until 2:30 pm. Another point worth mentioning: in addition to the normal Airbnb booking fee, there was an extra charge of $27.30 for a so-called "non-refundable damage waiver", without explaining what happened. This fee is charged regardless of whether or not damages were caused. I recommend that future guests read all the details.

Overall the space was perfect for what we needed over the weekend.  A few things need some minor repairs in the unit, but nothing major.  We didn't have enough towels for all staying in the room, but that was quickly alleviated by the team, which was nice.  Only one of the two elevators works in the building so if you need to use it and don't want to be waiting in line, I strongly auggest utilizing it in the early morning or late night hours.  The space was perfectly located for our needs on the trip.
The area was perfection as well as the cleanliness of the suite. Our host was very quick to respond to any questions we had and it was an overall lovely stay. Can‚Äôt wait to go back :)

Spent 3 days here with my friends for my birthday weekend! We had an absolute blast. The apartment is GORGEOUS from interior decorations to the stunning views through the floor to ceiling windows. Everyone slept super comfortably we spent so much time in the room because we were so obsessed hahaha ! It‚Äôs a great location in downtown with plenty of options for food, shopping, and exploring the beautiful city. Nomadic‚Äôs communicated great and made everything super easy with the self check in. Can‚Äôt wait to go back for another stay, definitely planning a longer trip just for this place üòçüòç
Very nice and clean space. Very comfortable beds. Easy check in process. Excellent communication with the host. Overall great experience. Would definitely stay here again.
Great place! Well worth staying here.
Looked bigger in photos but not small in person. Comfy beds and couch.
Great space in a perfect location, with wonderful communications.

I had an absolutely fantastic experience at this Airbnb! The property was exactly as described‚Äîclean, comfortable, and equipped with everything I needed for a relaxing stay. The location was perfect, close to all the key attractions, yet quiet enough to unwind after a long day.
What really stood out, however, was the host‚Äôs hospitality. They were incredibly responsive, thoughtful, and went above and beyond to make my stay special. From providing local recommendations to ensuring I had all the essentials, their attention to detail made me feel right at home.
I would highly recommend this Airbnb to anyone looking for a seamless, cozy, and welcoming place to stay. I‚Äôm already looking forward to my next visit!
Great location and place to stay!

location_details.title: Neighborhood highlights
location_details.value: Downtown Calgary is a vibrant hub in Alberta, Canada, characterized by a mix of modern skyscrapers and historic buildings set against the stunning backdrop of the Rocky Mountains. The cityscape is dominated by tall towers of glass and steel, housing corporate headquarters, financial institutions, and businesses.The Calgary Tower stands as an iconic landmark, offering panoramic views of the city and surrounding landscapes. The area is also home to cultural institutions like the Glenbow Museum and Arts Commons, hosting various performances and exhibitions throughout the year.Stephen Avenue Walk, a pedestrian street, is lined with shops, restaurants, and cafes, making it a bustling area for both locals and tourists. During the warmer months, Prince's Island Park becomes a focal point with its green spaces, walking trails, and hosting events like the Calgary Folk Music Festival.Calgary's downtown is well-connected through its extensive network of walkways known as the "+15 system," elevated indoor pedestrian bridges that link buildings, providing shelter during harsh winter months.The city's energy industry has historically been a significant part of its economy, reflected in the corporate presence downtown, but Calgary is also evolving into a more diverse and dynamic metropolitan area with a growing arts scene and a range of cultural activities.

location_details.title: Getting around
location_details.value: Navigating downtown Calgary is relatively straightforward and offers various transportation options for locals and visitors alike.Walking: The downtown core is pedestrian-friendly, especially along Stephen Avenue Walk and the riverfront. It's a great way to explore the shops, restaurants, and parks in the area. The +15 system, a network of indoor pedestrian bridges, also allows for convenient travel between buildings, particularly during winter when temperatures drop.Public Transit: Calgary Transit operates an efficient network of buses and the CTrain (light rail transit) that serves downtown. The CTrain has multiple stations within the downtown area, making it convenient for getting around. The fare system allows for easy transfers between buses and trains if needed.Biking: Calgary has dedicated bike lanes and pathways, making cycling a viable option for navigating the downtown core. Bike-sharing programs like Lime or other rental services are available for short-term use.Driving: While driving is an option, traffic congestion during peak hours can be a concern. There are parking lots and street parking available, but it might be more convenient to use public transit or alternative means of transportation due to potential traffic and parking challenges.Ride-Sharing and Taxis: Ride-sharing services like Uber and Lyft operate in Calgary, providing additional flexibility for getting around downtown. Taxis are also readily available for shorter trips or convenience.Overall, the city's layout and transportation options make it relatively easy to move around downtown Calgary, offering various choices based on individual preferences and needs.

Your stay is an immersion into city living at its finest, where every moment resonates with sophistication and convenience.Get ready for an unforgettable stay in the heart of downtown Calgary!

description_html:
Welcome to The Domain!

Discover downtown Calgary's gem! With captivating skyline vistas through floor-to-ceiling windows, a private balcony overlooking the city, and king-sized beds for utmost comfort, this space defines urban luxury.

Enjoy an open kitchen, access to a gym, and a refreshing pool. Your stay is an immersion into city living at its finest, where every moment resonates with sophistication and convenience.

Get ready for an unforgettable stay in the heart of downtown Calgary!

Other things to note
• LICENSE #: BL267943

• Please make sure to read and explore your Boarding Pass for detailed check-in ( and check-out) instructions and other information you need during and after your stay.

Note: The availability of the pool is not guaranteed as the building management closes it without prior notice.

We understand that accidents can happen during your stay, and we want to ensure that both you and the property are protected.
For your peace of mind, we offer two options:
1) Non-refundable Damage Waiver: For a small fee, this waiver covers accidental damages (up to $250) during your stay.
2) Refundable Safety Deposit: A credit card hold, that will be refunded upon a successful property inspection after your stay.
These options will be presented to you through our Guest App after booking.

The Calgary Tower stands as an iconic landmark, offering panoramic views of the city and surrounding landscapes. The area is also home to cultural institutions like the Glenbow Museum and Arts Commons, hosting various performances and exhibitions throughout the year.

Stephen Avenue Walk, a pedestrian street, is lined with shops, restaurants, and cafes, making it a bustling area for both locals and tourists. During the warmer months, Prince's Island Park becomes a focal point with its green spaces, walking trails, and hosting events like the Calgary Folk Music Festival.

Calgary's downtown is well-connected through its extensive network of walkways known as the "+15 system," elevated indoor pedestrian bridges that link buildings, providing shelter during harsh winter months.

The city's energy industry has historically been a significant part of its economy, reflected in the corporate presence downtown, but Calgary is also evolving into a more diverse and dynamic metropolitan area with a growing arts scene and a range of cultural activities.

Bottom line: luxury it is not. This place needs a deep clean, proper maintenance, and a host who‚Äôs willing to put some effort into the experience. I would not stay here again or recommend it to anyone.

We (4 colleagues on a work trip) enjoyed our stay at this airbnb & would recommend it. The airbnb had a pullout couch (fits 2 people tightly), a rollaway cot (fits 1 person), 1 king bed in 1 room, & another king bed in another room. The bedrooms are quite small - just a bed & some space to walk around it/put your stuff. There are 2 full bathroom, one attached to one bedroom & another attached to the living room. The bathrooms were functional & clean as was the kitchen (we struggled & failed to get the dishwasher to work, but that could have been user error?) & the washer/dryer. The view from the balcony is stunning - we spent a lot of time there. While the airbnb company sent instructions on how to get in, we did struggle entering the complex. There is also only one key fob which we had to juggle/share amongst 4 independent adults which was a bit difficult and cumbersome. The area was alright - walkable, close to downtown but there were a fair number of unhoused folks nearby.
Condo was nice but no shades in one of the rooms, Location was loud, and no sheets for pull out.
reviews_details.host_response:
Thank you for your feedback. We're glad you found the condo nice, though we're sorry to hear about the missing shades --that has been broken by the previous guest; but we're working on replacing it already.
Noise was out of our control, as it is the location itself.
For the the pull-out bed we usually prepare backup sheets inside the bedroom closet. We appreciate you bringing this to our attention‚Äîyour comments help us improve, and we‚Äôll make sure these concerns are addressed for future guests.

reviews_details.review: Nomadics Vacation rentals sent extremely detailed check in and check out instructions and the apartment matched the pictures shown in the listing. The apartment was extremely clean and clutter free. The amenities at this location looked nice although we did not have time to use any of them. We were unfortunately moved to this apartment after the initial apartment had an extremely last minute plumbing issue. The last minute nature of this issue and the communication regarding the change was rather frustrating. In addition, this new apartment had 1 less bedroom than my original booking. Forcing us to utilize the pull out bed, which would have been no big deal if sheets for this bed had been provided or available. In addition, all the extra pillows were provided with no pillow cases. we pulled pillows off the real beds for the couch to use. Location was easily walkable to the other downtown areas.
stains on the bath towel and sofa cushion, no curtain or blinds in one room which is extremely inconvenient and no privacy, should not happen with appartement like this

Unfortunately, our experience was quite disappointing. We arrived at the apartment on February 6th at 10:46 pm and immediately had trouble getting into the building. The doorman was unfriendly and unwilling to help, and the building control panel was very confusing, the buttons didn't work properly and there were no clear instructions. Inside the apartment, the curtain in the suite was damaged, which compromised our privacy, as we had to sleep completely exposed to the outside light. The next day, we asked for some flexibility with the check-out time, but the host was completely inflexible and wanted to charge an additional $125 just to stay until 2:30 pm. Another point worth mentioning: in addition to the normal Airbnb booking fee, there was an extra charge of $27.30 for a so-called "non-refundable damage waiver", without explaining what happened. This fee is charged regardless of whether or not damages were caused. I recommend that future guests read all the details.

Overall the space was perfect for what we needed over the weekend.  A few things need some minor repairs in the unit, but nothing major.  We didn't have enough towels for all staying in the room, but that was quickly alleviated by the team, which was nice.  Only one of the two elevators works in the building so if you need to use it and don't want to be waiting in line, I strongly auggest utilizing it in the early morning or late night hours.  The space was perfectly located for our needs on the trip.

And thank you for the heads-up about the elevator, nonetheless, the maintenance of it is something out of our control.
No worries, we'll be sure to bring that up to the building management.
We'd love to host you again anytime you're back in the area!
